caption: Had lunch on Easter Sunday in their outdoor dining area which looked so classy with white table cloth and fresh cut flowers. The indoor space was more amazing. Btw, the food was great and the service was excellent. Hot Tan tan noodle was perfect, the dry sautéed crispy beef was “must try” and snow pea sprouts in broth was so fresh and tasty. Like the Jasmine hot tea. Gonna come back for dinner dishes.
The food was amazing the staff was great. The chef greeted us at the door and even visited our table. The best food ever.
The chef is fantastic. Really keeps the authentic taste alive through his dishes.
Wonderful place. We are from Miami and we loved it!!
Amazing service and great food! Very authentic and tasty. I recommend the 干煸四季豆 and 辣子鸡丁 (it is spicy though!). Will come back when I visit NYC again!

We had a great dinner here! A perfect spot if you’re looking for a classic Chinatown feel while having a bit more of an upscale vibe than some other restaurants in the area. The menu is very extensive which was great for 2 vegetarians in the group.
Table side carved duck 🦆

It's a restaurant experience The  Waiters the hostess Everyone is so nice and the food is delicious The owner came to our table spoke with us made sure we enjoyed our food i will  Definitely be going back Try the Duck it is Delicious thank me later 😋

This place is special to me.  I was a customer as a small child in the 70s and 80s, when it closed I was very upset.  I found out about 2 years ago it had returned, and I couldn't wait to go.  The place is beautiful, the food was an absolute time warp back 30+ years.  The cold noodles and sesame sauce was just as good as I remembered!  Overall the food is excellent!!  I was lucky enough to talk with chef Tang when I was there, talking about old times.  I wish my Dad were alive to go, it was his favorite place.  Now my children have experienced it and it was fantastic.  I am a customer for life!
Super authentic Peking duck

I came here with group of friends and had high expectations....  The food itself is okay, but way too expensive for what it is. Charged fine ding price but really hole in the wall place service. Chipped serving plates like previous review.  But what really bothered me was the Chef guy came to our table and never left. He hijacked the conversion, and turned the topic to himself and himself only. His hands were touching my friend's arms while he was  making his uninvited speech ...and encouraged the whole table got up and toast every 5 minute.. I was really confused and bothered by this kind gesture. Not sure if this is a culture thing but it was certainly a turn off for me.

Food was okay but not worth the price, the decor is clean and nicer than most chinatown restaurants but it's not anything special.  Peking duck wrap was served cold...... we would go to pecking duck house next time when we crave for pecking duck.  Sour cabbage fatty beef soup was a fail, no taste of sour cabbage, rather hint of black vinegar... it's like hot and sour soup with fatty beef but without the proper seasoning- fail.  All the serving wear were chipped in multiple areas, gotta be careful scratching yourself.  All the signs show lack of proper management. The Chef/ Owner came out and talked bragged about his own vision of life time achievement and how unique/fresh the food is... talked cross over people's drinks and groped while he talked ( his hand was always touching an audience's body) , it was really distributing and unprofessional. We came here for fine food and pleasant dining experience, not the unwanted attention/borderline sexual harassment from the owner, or ear full of his childhood struggle and how he moved to the State....  The dining experience was ODD to say at the least. Not worth the price to return. We should be paid to listen to the owner talking our ears out the whole night... exhausting.
They serve large portions and for convenient pricing. super friendly staff. Will visit again.
Not good, great good. Outstanding service. Excellent

Eating at this beautiful establishment was an absolute joy. Food is beyond amazing and the hospitality even better. One of the very best food experiences of my life! Must haves: crispy beef, soup dumplings, lobster, duck. All we’re out of this world. One of the best restaurants in NYC for sure!
Must order the Beijing duck and chili see bass if you come to this place!!
Amazing food friendly service.
Best Peking duck, good service and beautiful restaurant
I love this place a lot. there is a nice spirit. The cuisine is marvelous. the service is effective and the waiters are professional. The pay is satisfactory. I highly recommend.
Was in the area, googled healthy food and this place popped up. Stopped for lunch and was a little surprised. Walked in the store was empty but they were prepping food for orders.
Great Peking Duck. The staff is the friendliest staff in Chinatown, they don’t try and usher you out like the Peking Duck house. Food is great.
Ok
Great

I would really love to give a 4/5 star to this restaurant since I have been seeing so many great feedback from different platforms so I decide to give it a try (also to support local business during this difficult time.)  We ordered Peking duck, Dong Po Pork and Tang's Amazing Tofu for takeout. Arrived on time for pick up and wait for 10 minutes more, not a big deal.  To begin with, Peking duck isn’t the best we have had in the city; a bit soggy, not much aroma and the pancake is doughy.(perhaps we order half duck so it isn’t... made the same day?). Tofu is fine. The biggest problem is the pork, at first taste the pork is sour. Having been to China many times, I really don’t think the seasoning is right. It’s pretty blend. We have to throw away the $30 pork since the meat is not fresh and eatable. What a disappointment.  Perhaps the chef is not on site yesterday for supervision. But if my feedback could be seen and taken into consideration, I will love to give the place another chance.

The service was amazing! We had incredible ribs, delicious shrimp fried rice, fantastic noodles, and wonton soup. Takeout was incredibly quick and our order was ready before we even arrived. The wonton soup was just ok (a little bland) and the food is a little pricey but I highly recommend it overall.
(Translated by Google) Roast duck is delicious  (Original) 烤鸭好好吃
Quality of dishes are so high, flavour is so refined. My top pick Chinese food in NYC.

I didnt even get a chance to eat because our server took 20 mins to acknowledge us after dropping a drinking on our table. My partner and I came in the restaurant we were seated immediatly, given a drink menu then left alone for 20 mins. A larger group of ppl came in and was served water and a food menu. At that point we got up and left the restaurant. And the restaurant was not busy at all. We were 1 of 3 tables each table had 2 ppl on it, then the group of 8 came and was serviced immediately. I would not recommend because of this bad service.
Good food, great service. A little overpriced given the portion sizes.
Great food and service , we love the duck lettuce wraps
Superb service met with the most delicious food. Staff was extremely kind and patient with our group. Can't beat the Soup dumplings, crispy beef, and duck. Already planning the next visit.

I really like this neighborhood joint. The food is excellent, especially the pot stickers and dry fried green beens. But the fact that they have great beers and the food prices are really low makes this a standard in my restaurant rotation
Delicious food, would recommend to order fish. It’s full of flavour and pretty big portion) better to share with someone.

Hello Sir Goodmorning I just wanted to discuss some personal matter with you where you can grow ur business into high level of walkins send me ur mail id or just drop ur mail on ravitalakokula@gmail.com Waiting for your positive reply  Thanks & Regards Ravikanth
Chinese food, very tasty. Had a friend come into town and she asked me to take her here again. The bill was decent. I can see why they have a lot of positive reviews.
My husband and I have been here many of times. We always geeked very welcomed by the staff and the food is fantastic.

(Translated by Google) A very low-key but dedicated Michelin restaurant! Douban fish and roast duck are too classic, and shredded beef is also very unique~ It's so touching to be able to eat such authentic roast duck in a foreign country! Boss Tang is so nice. He told us about the past and present of Huayuan, and he can see his professionalism and love for cooking. Such a good store hopes to be seen by more people! ❤️  (Original) 一家非常低调却用心做菜的米其林餐厅！豆瓣鱼和烤鸭太经典了，牛肉丝也很独特～能在异国他乡吃到这么正宗的烤鸭真的太感动啦！唐老板人太nice了，给我们讲了华园的前世今生，可以看出他对烹饪的专业和极度喜爱。这样的好店希望被更多人看到！❤️

Really really great Chinese food in Chinatown.  Sauces are made the authentic way. The head chef is the son of the head chef of the original restaurant, which opened in the 60’s.  They’ve been struggling during the pandemic, show up to help this great restaurant!
I ordered take out for my sons birthday, it was wonderful  and delicious dinner
Boss came out and told us about the history of his restaurant and then thanked us for coming and gave us a ma po tofu on the house! Food tastes great

After trying several places in China Town and not quite finding what we were looking for, we came here and found it all! The cold noodles with sesame oil is as good as everyone say it is. The tangy crispy beef is technically an appetizer but it's more like an amazing candy. The Pekin duck was as good as the ones we had in China, and even though a half is big enough for two we had to try another dish so we also enjoyed the spicy and special lamb rack. The service was great and the staff did their best to try and provide an upscale feeling despite the outside dining limitations. We will definitely come again.

we had the sesame noodles, soup dumplings,  Beijing duck, orange beef, and mapo tofu. everything was delicious!! can't recommend them enough! service was impeccable! the chef was great and very welcoming, even came to have a conversation with us. we thoroughly enjoyed our dinner here.
chinese food and the scene here is excellent. one of the best spots of its kind in the area. the service was very helpful and welcoming. prices are decent for the quality.

Found this on a list of best beef noodle soup in the city. I am a huge fan of beef noodle soup and this was okay at best. The noodles were overcooked, beef was dry and broth had almost no flavor. It also came with a whole head of bok choy in it which was nearly impossible to eat. Honestly extremely disappointed. If you want beef noodle soup go to very fresh noodles instead.

We had a lovely time dining outdoors at Hwa Yuan -it felt like we were hosted by a family for dinner. Staff was so generous, professional and nice, and the food was excellent. We got the famous cold sesame noodles and the Pekin Duck pictured here. The street was quite on a Saturday night and it was really cool to be able to experience dining outside. Walking in to use the restroom it was heartbreaking to see such a beautiful restaurant standing empty and closed for indoor service.

Outdoor seating available! Delicious food - we enjoyed the seafood noodles, half duck, pork dumplings, soup dumplings and wonton dumplings. All of these except the pork dumplings were awesome!! Particularly the duck & wonton dumplings. Duck is served with these delicious home made savoury pancakes which are fresh out of the oven! Our waiter brought out the duck and cut it in front of us, she was a lot of fun!  Service were super nice and attentive. Definitely would return!

This is just high quality food and I'm guessing only available for delivery due to the sad state of pandemic. Get it while you can. Awesome soup dumplings that held together without having a grossly thick wrapper. Great wine chicken. The best sesame noodles. Thank you for continuing to serve delicious food!
I think , this restaurant is good for non vegetarian and Chinese people.
Hwa Yuan Szechuan is established, well regarded fine dining.  I've eaten here several times and always enjoy the delicious food and attentive service.
I did a takeout order earlier today. They were extremely nice and the food was outstanding! It is awesome to be able to get great food like this for takeout.

This place is wonderful. The restaurant specializes in Chongqing dishes and their noodles are excellent. I ordered take-out on my first visit and can't wait to return. Everything I tried, including the beef noodle dish (my favorite), was memorable. Five stars.

Excellent Sichuan restaurant. We got takeout in April during the CV pandemic and they had a really nice takeout operation going with a set menu. We tried the non vegetarian version and loved it.  Well done!

Sesame flavored noodles has great flavor but has doubts over the noodles itself as it tasted similar to raw noodles both in texture and flavor. Will prefer to have springy texture.  Mapo Tofu is soft and tender yet does not pack any umami flavor on it.  Spring onion pancake has a nice crispy crunch but no spring onion flavor at all with doughy center.  Given the price paid, it is totally a let down. In other words, a SCAM to those who hasn't tasted real szechuan cantonese food. Not recommended for authentic szechuan cuisine

This place is my preferred one. I go to many restaurants but to this place I go the most. The crew is very helpful and the cuisine they cook is so tasty. I would always prefer to have a good dinner in this place. Highly recommended.
They offer a nice variety of delicious food. I loved eating here. Staff members are always kind, rates are reasonable and the place is always kept clean.
Crispy fried beef, get in my belly!
Best Chinese sour soup I’ve had

10/10 stars This place is amazing. So polite. Extreamly accommodating. Food does come fast and prepared to perfection. You are not rushed and the staff makes you feel very weclome. The special Beijing duck signature dinner was beyond amazing. So so 1000 times so good. For the price and quantity you cannot go wrong. I would recommend this place for all occasions. Come hungry!! Looking forward to finding any reason or occasion to come back.
This is an authentic Chinese restaurant. Omgggg the food was amazing!!! I highly recommend this place. Here are pictures of the food i ordered.
Average food with really bad service, do not recommend!
This place was awesome. Great space and very different than the quick local restaurants. Yes, it is pricier but certainly much more of an experience than just "grabbing some grub".

Everything in the huge two-story restaurant looks brand new, from the ironed tablecloths to the two pairs of chopsticks everyone gets (one for yourself, and one for eating). But what really counts is that you can find here one of the best Peking ducks in town. You can order your duck as part of a set-course dinner if there are four or more of you or have it carved tableside, à la carte, and for $40, the half-bird option is one of the better Peking duck deals in town. If you add to all the above the kind attention of all the staff, from the moment the maitre greets you at the door to the moment the waiter says goodbye when he hands you the bill, the result is a place you can't miss on your next trip to Chinatown.
Thanks,Thanks I Hope thats Everything it's Honestly the True! When I Eat There,Then I will said..😉💯🇵🇷
Exceptional experience.  Business lunch was amazing.

By far the best XLB (they taste wayyyy better than they look) and best Peking duck I’ve ever had. Our group was travelling from Vancouver and tried out this place because of Buzzfeed’s Worth it and it way exceeded our expectations. I don’t usually go back to places I’ve been to before if I’m not a local (gotta try a little bit of everything you know) but this may honestly be the best meal I ever had. Totally worth it. The chef was also super kind and greeted us and gave us a complimentary dessert when we told him we were from out of town!
Best duck in town!!!

Had a great Lunar New Year dinner here last night with some close friends. Came because of the history and good reviews. We ordered the duck, which they are known for, which did not disappoint. Everyone really enjoyed the crispy beef as well. Good soup dumplings, sautéed eggplant, fish in a special glaze, snow pea leaves with garlic. Also like that it is a quieter corner of Chinatown. Multiple subway lines, tho a good digestive walk to any of them.
Fabulous food

Summary: Upscale Chinese restaurant specializing in Szechuan cuisine and delectable Peking duck. Both the Peking duck and cold noodles with sesame sauce are legendary. The service and ambiance are also excellent.  Must Try: Peking duck and Cold noodles with sesame sauce. Also recommended: Sizzling beef with scallop and vegetable. Avoid: N/A  ⭐⭐⭐⭐ - Great, worth a detour
(Translated by Google) it is good  (Original) 好

Went to try the famous cold noodle. Was okay I have to say. Could do with a bit more spiciness. The initial male server was in a hurry to get our order for some odd reason. We arrived at noon, the first guests as that too. The kind lady that served us the noodle and the scallion pancake was the best part of the meal. She was pleasant and knowledgeable to answer our questions. 4 stars because oh her.

My son wanted Peking duck. The last time we ate it was in 2017 so he was due. Previously, we had gone to Peking Duck House on Mott street in Chinatown. We had fond memories of it, but looking at recent reviews, it sounded like it had lost its sheen. After a quick search, Hwa Yuan came up as a solid recommendation for Chinese food in general, but Peking duck (or as they correctly call it, Beijing duck). Having another friend who happened to be there earlier that day who highly recommended it sealed the deal for us. Chinatown is an interesting neighborhood where you'll find marketplaces that look like they've been around for decades with cut up cardboard with prices sharpied onto it juxtaposed next to completely renovated remodeled edifices with glass and clean lines. Hwa Yuan was the latter - kind of a modern oasis on a street still fighting progress. So first impressions - interior decor: very clean and modern. We made reservations via OpenTable so no waiting. We were taken to the second floor. Note that the space is partially sectioned off giving the quasi-private room feel without totally making you feel like you're on your own. There were several waitstaff personnel always around at any given time. And they weren't the useless kind that just stand around to give the impression of service. Our waters were constantly refilled and someone was always available to bring a replacement chopstick or something. They used heavy plates with a large one underneath a medium sized plate which was frequently taken away and replaced with a fresh one. They even provided two sets of chopsticks which we had never seen before and when asked, the staff responded that one set is for serving yourself from the public family style plates onto your plate, while the other chopstick set is for you to actually eat off your plate. Genius - but you better hope your fellow diners remembered which one was for what. So the waiter explained that the Beijing duck could take up to 45 minutes to prepare so you can imagine our surprise when our duck appeared after only a few minutes. My only explanation is that in my OpenTable reservation, I put in the comments that we were going to order the duck so maybe they got one going in advance of our arrival. The duck was very well sliced and a nice pile of extra duck skin was provided as well. Small plates of the duck accouterments (e.g., slivers of spring onions, asian pear, and cucumber) as well as a bamboo steam basket of the wrappers were brought out. This was disappointingly small portioned - we easily went through 3 refills of the stuff before we ran out of duck. But the duck was deliciously fatty and crispy, married with the crunchy slivers, with a touch of the hoisin sauce resulted in a luxurious combination. The one other disappointment was that the wrappers were ripped with dry edges. But they tasted good and provided a good vessel for all the fillings. Quick notes on the other dishes: snow pea shoots in garlic sauce- just ok (e.g., pretty generic); mapotofu-tasty but not that spicy (could have been victim to my dining buddy asking for everything to be mild); house special hunan chicken-very delicious; pork soup dumplings-nice and soupy and very tasty; cold sesame noodles-came highly recommended but not really my thing due to its slightly acidified sesame oil taste and the weirdly dense texture of the noodles; pan fried noodles with seafood-very delicious with plenty of fried noodles. In general, all the food was pretty tasty but felt overpriced (or underportioned, especially since the serving plates are huge). At the end of the day, the restaurant was a very upscaled Chinese food restaurant, high on the authenticity levels but (necessarily) high on the price side. Definitely an elevated Chinese food experience - well suited for folks looking for a solid food experience in a place much nicer than your corner Chinese takeout.

When: Saturday at 8pm Party Size: 20 with reservation  Came here for a birhtday dinner. Place was packed to the brim even with a reservation we had about a 15-20 minute wait time. The food overall is delicious - fancied up Chinese food. You can definitely find food nearby that tastes as good for half the price. The Peking duck is the star of the show. Definitely get one. We ordered a ton of food that the head chef gave us a few free dishes on the house - what a gesture. He even came out to chat with us and get our feedback on the food. That was pretty cool.  Service: 10/10 Gave us a complimentary round of beers and a nice seafood dish. Very friendly folks. Food came out hot and quick.  Ambiance: 8/10 Clean, modern, and felt ritzy  Overall: 8/10 It's an expensive place, but the food is great. You get what you pay for.
Michelin 2-star

My two brothers, their SOs & I had a very good meal Wednesday night; three appetizers, three entrees & two desserts. Very tasty variety, well prepared and presented. Hard to choose what to order, so many dishes were grabbing our fancies. No problem getting there, none of us live in Manhattan
Loved the Peking duck!  The house special fish was a delight!  Friendly staff - ask them for recommendations!  You can’t go wrong. We even got to meet the chef!
The food and service are excellent. The ambient just as nice, will definitely go back.

This place is entirely overpriced, the food is average.  Many reviewers mention the duck (which I will agree looks amazing) but don’t get anything else from there.  Overly /extremely spicy with no flavor.   Small portions.    Thoroughly disappointed

Epic. Literally stumbled upon this place whilst waiting for another (seemingly worse) place with an hour's wait. They put us at the bar for 5-10 mins whilst they found us (2) a table, transferred the bar tab to the table, no muss no fuss. Happy to take the order for starters and mains (appetizers and entrees) to come out together. Christmas Day and very busy so I can't fault them for struggling to get it all out at once; they kept the food coming quickly enough for us to share and be satisfied. (If we'd had our own each we'd have been disappointed.) They apologised and provided freebies for the wait (veggie dumplings, not our taste but fair enough), cancelled the rice side and added more crispy beef per our last-minute request.  It was fun watching shredded duck pancakes being served to adjacent tables, very different to what we've seen before in the UK.  All-in-all, excellent food, attentive service, reasonable prices. Five stars.

(Translated by Google) This is a restaurant that lied to foreigners, Cannot believe there are so many people like this place. Totally a tourist trap not authentic at all. Our duck arrived cold. The tortilla was also uncooked and tasted like flour. They took our dish back and nobody I do n’t know why there is good reviews in this place. The duck has no heat. It has become cold after slicing. It is very greasy. The duck pie skin is very thick and chaotic. It is floury before it is steamed. The waiter took the dishes away. We waited for 50 minutes and didn't change our dishes. The steamed pork ribs can't bite without steaming.  (Original) 这是一个骗老外的饭店，Cannot believe there are so many people like this place. Totally a tourist trap not authentic at all. Our duck arrived cold. The tortilla was also uncooked and tasted like flour. They took our dish back and nobody 这个地方不知道为什么有好评，鸭子端上来已经没有热气，切片以后已经凉了，很腻，鸭子饼皮是混沌皮擀的非常厚，还没有蒸熟都是面粉味. 服务员把菜端走，我们等了50分钟还没有给我们换菜上来。粉蒸排骨蒸没有蒸透根本咬不动。

Don’t waste your time visiting this place. It’s a total tourist trap. Don’t believe the Michelin Star and the “fancy” decor. The service is terrible and the duck is cold and not crispy. The bing for the roast duck is floury and thick. It should be light and airy.  My recommendation: go to China and get real roast duck. You won’t be disappointed like you will be here.

Overpriced and pretentious - trying too hard to appeal to WASPy ideas of what a ~fine dining~ experience is supposed to be like. That said some of the food was very good, although mostly it was just about average for a "real Chinese restaurant"
Best service, and awesome food.
Not as great as it used to be but still very much worth the visit.  Clean, high end Chinese in Chinatown.  Street parking available on weekends.
Elegant setting & excellent food!

I like pretty much everything that we ordered. The duck is great but I feel that it’s pretty similar to most places in Chinatown. The shrimps however, are quite big and juicy, my favorite thing to order here.
Delicious duck and crispy beef. Excellent customer service. Try it out!
Everything was great
Decoration and atmosphere are good. Food is not bad just average.
Excellent food and service.
Delicious food and great service for the price!
Chinese fine dining. Not easy to find a restaurant with this emphasis on service and decor in this neighborhood.
Fancy service, and very well executed classics.
Wonderful service and better food, especially the duck!
Excellent food!!

The Peking duck was absolutely amazing. The skin was prepared really well. It had the perfect amount of fat and crisp which made every bite juicy and savory. Our waitress did a great job cutting the duck. She extracted as much meat as she could. We decided to take the duck carcous back home to make soup the next day.  Overall, the food is cooked with a very high level of care compared to other Chinese restaurants. Because of this, it is reflected in the price. In conclusion, my family and I enjoyed our dinner because of the exceptional service and food. I highly recommend Hwa Yuan Szechuan if you're looking for an upscale Chinese restaurant.
The food here is so good! We had the usual signature dishes of mapo tofu, shrimp, crispy duck pancakes etc and they were super tasty! Highly recommend :)

Absolutely love this place. Service is excellent. I’ve eaten in and have ordered a huge take out for a family event. Delicious Peking Duck. Ambiance is very elegant so it makes up for the price, and the food is really great! Love their manager David, and the chef himself! Always so friendly and welcoming.

The duck is quite pricey ($70ish) but ever since Chef Ho's closing, there's really no good alternative in Manhattan. Worth a visit and potentially more albeit a teeny bit hard to get to. Really good service and quite nice interiors.

Definitely on the pricier side for this part of town, but the food was exceptional. Do yourself a favor and skip the duck though. It's better in other places and there are a ton of other great options to fill up on here. Don't miss the cold sesame noodles or the spicy wine chicken

To get good Chinese food, go to Chinatown. It is so worth it! While visiting NYC with the kids and friends, we took our party to this place and they were able to seat our party of 8 without a reservation, The place is up market, very clean, and super attentive staff. They keep the place running with a hum. Its not pressured, but they make sure the guest have everything they need. Order some starters, main dishes and a Peking duck - all excellent. Nothing we ordered was bad at all. It may not be the cheapest of places, but if you take effort to visit this place (it is off the beaten path a little, but otherwise safe looking place), you will not be disappointed. The chef greeted us on the way out and can be seen mingling with his guests - very charming.
Nice, legit Chinese food
Fairly expensive for what was offered. The food was good, but not as good as I expected it to be to match the price.
(Translated by Google) Eat roast duck at noon  (Original) 中午来吃烤鸭

We had the 85$ Beijing duck signature dinner course menu. It’s served family style; food portion was big. Every dish was great, especially their cold sesame noodles were top notch. Peking duck was good, but the steamed pancakes that came with the duck for wrapping were a bit dry and powdery. We asked for a little more of the pancakes since there were still lots of duck slices left; not many pancakes were served with a whole duck. They extra charged us for the pancakes without mentioning.
Love the cold sesame noodles and crispy beef.
Absolutely phenomenal food! Everything was great and can’t beat the price point.

(Translated by Google) Excellent lacquered duck and impeccable service! Really amazing for getting price there! ($ 55 the whole duck with pancakes, vegetables and rice for 4 people!) Very quiet atmosphere, comfortable room and we even had the right to cut the duck in front of us.  (Original) Excellent canard laquée et service impeccable ! Vraiment incroyable pour se prix là ! (55$ le canard entier avec crêpes, légumes et riz pour 4 personnes !) Ambiance très calme, salle comfortable et on a même eu le droit à la découpe du canard devant nous.

(Translated by Google) Unbeatable value for money for a lunch! The whole duck a treat! Waiters listening. I highly recommend  (Original) Rapport qualité prix imbattable pour un lunch ! Le whole duck un régal ! Serveurs à l'écoute.  Je recommande vivement
Top notch, best of the best quality Chinese food in Chinatown. Wanna get served: make it quick and order here. This is quality... not quantity!!!!
Very good service, food is good
Best Szechuan in the United States, hands down
Love this place!  Tasty food , great service, and warm ambiance.
(Translated by Google) Roast duck is good  (Original) 烤鴨不錯
(Translated by Google) Love freeze  (Original) Love frys
(Translated by Google) Great food, wide selection and very kind staff. Recommended!  (Original) Ottimo cibo, vasta scelta e personale gentilissimo. Consigliato!

(Translated by Google) Wonderful Chinese restaurant. Courtesy and cleanliness of the highest order! The menu is great. I recommend trying the noodles and the roast duck which, besides being excellent, is a real pleasure to see it prepared. Absolutely recommended  (Original) Meraviglioso ristorante cinese. Cortesia e pulizia di prim’ordine! Il menu è ottimo. Consiglio di provare i noodles e l’anatra arrosto che oltre che ottima è un vero piacere vederla preparare. Consigliato assolutamente

They have the BEST cold sesame noodles and incredible Beijing duck. Skip the Hutong hype and usual Peking duck place on Mott and just come here. Yes the prices are a bit higher than normal Chinese restaurants in the neighborhood, but I am so happy that we have a restaurant that is truly worth the incremental price. Yumyumyum!
(Translated by Google) Yummmm !!! $$  (Original) Yummmm!!!$$

One of the BEST meals of ANY cuisine I have ever had!  Service was exceptional, and the Michelon Chef, Hwa Yuan, smiles and waved to us on the way out!  I think I'll be going at least 2-3 times a month!
(Translated by Google) Yummoooo  (Original) Yummoooo
Expensive and mediocre. Tried to order beef tendon appetizer and was told it's no longer available. Had spicy beef, fish and string beans. Food is ok and not authentic Szechuan.

Sigh, dated restaurant that's not recommended if you want spicy Szechuan food.  The service was... awkward... example: twirling noodles and serving them in a big heap. They couldn't figure out when and how to clear plates.  Some of the food was tasty, some meh - but Szechuan should be spicy, and this was not spicy at all. It had chilis but maybe the wrong kind or something? No seriously, I'm not just acclimated to heat, this wasn't even sriracha-level spicy. We even ordered chili sauce and it wasn't spicy either.  Of course, it's very expensive as well. $70 each for dinner before drinks.  Some recommendations that are perfectly clean, delicious and easy to get a large table: Wu Wonton King (call ahead for whole roast pig!), Ping, Mission Chinese (spicy!).  OWNERS: two easy ways to improve: 1) ask your patrons how spicy they would like the food, and make the chili sauce spicy. 2) reduce prices by 10-15% to match other restaurants. if you do this, I will come back and update the review.
Peking duck is good.
Amazing and Tasty food. Very fresh and made to order. Definitely try the Mapo tofu...its yumm! The atmosphere is warm and welcoming. Will definitely come back and recommend others!!

(Translated by Google) Although we suddenly became 6 people for a reservation with 4 people, we prepared a pleasant seat The staff was very friendly and the Peking Duck was high quality at a price that I couldn't believe in New York The noodles and sour bath were also delicious!  (Original) 4人での予約に対して急遽6人になったものの快く席を用意してくださいました スタッフの対応がとても良く、北京ダックはニューヨークとは思えない価格で高クオリティでした 麺類や酸辣湯も美味しかったです！

Had an amazing experience celebrating my husband’s birthday here. The food is incredible, the service is exceptional, and you leave with a full belly and a big smile. I can’t recommend this place enough!

Honestly at first I was weirded out by how much attention we received. Everyone treated us like royalty. I'm not used to that. We ordered steamed dumplings, bok choy and (drum roll 🥁) the Peking Duck!!!! The Peking Duck is carved at the table and is served with wraps and sliced veggies with sauce. I've never had Peking Duck before but all I can say is WOW!!!! Amazing 🙌 coming to this restaurant was the highlight of my 15yr olds whole trip to NYC. We only ordered the half for 40 dollars and it was more than enough but we could probably finished a whole. So good and I highly recommend.
The best Chinese food I have ever had!
A Chinatown landmark & classic place to dine.
Amazing duck!
Very nice

Mapo Tofu here is one of the best I’ve had in the city. The entire experience was a mixed review since some dishes were not worth the price (braised fish with spicy chili oil for $45) and then some were seriously very good. We ended up ordering a lot of things and were glad we tried the place out. The chef checked up on us often. Friendly staff, a little mix up with the check at the end but would happily return.

(Translated by Google) I went to Da Dong and went home. I came to this place to fill the belly of the roast duck. Huayuan's roast duck is quite delicious on Man Island. It is much more delicious than Da Dong. At least it is not firewood. Although it is not comparable to domestic ones, it is very good. Maybe it is because of the duck breed problem, the skin is not crisp enough. I can't experience the pleasure of duck skin and white sugar. His family environment is very good, counted in front of Chinatown, and then the noodles with sesame sauce is particularly delicious. Other cooking has been visited several times. Every time there is a difference in taste, just look at it.  (Original) 去了Da Dong失望而归，为了填补想吃烤鸭的肚子来到这家。华园的烤鸭算是曼岛上比较好吃的了，比Da Dong的好吃多了，起码不柴，虽然说比不上国内的，但很不错了，可能因为鸭子品种问题吧，皮不够脆，体验不到鸭皮蘸白糖的快感。他家环境非常好，在Chinatown算前几名了，然后麻酱凉面特别好吃，其他的炒菜去过几次，每次味道都有出入，随便看着点吧。
Helena was the one who helped us, She is really the best!!!
Pricey... But sooo much fun and great food

An upscale Chinese restaurant. The interiors are elegant, pleasant and relaxing. The service is excellent - very courteous and friendly. The seating is very comfortable. They use of good quality table cloth, napkins and bone China plates makes dining here a pleasurable experience. The food, both in terms of quality and taste is amazingly good. Went for lunch. It was an enjoyable and satisfying meal. Obviously, all good things come at a price. It is on the expensive side but we'll worth it. Will absolutely be going back.
Great combo of Peking duck and Sichuan food

Their duck is absolutely amazing!!! I moved to NYC from DC a year ago. I was looking for a good Peking Duck restaurant for some time since me and my wife missed the one in DC a lot. Now I think I found it, their duck tastes so delicious and the soup was so good. The service was very good. People are kind and nice. 5 stars! Not easy from a picky Chinese foodie.
Excellent food and service! Genuine Chinese cuisine. Beautifully decorated and great ambience.
The foods are excellent and service is exceptional.
Lovely! Fantastic food and great service. Visit this nice restaurant!

Best birthday dinner experience, ever. The manager, William made our meal special and his advice was excellent. Signature cold noodles were exceptional, 'Marvellous Orange Beef' so tasty and the accompanying dishes equally so.  Meeting the chef and having a dish of his hand made Sichuan noodles were sublime. Hope we can make it again when visiting NYC again. Many Thanks to all the staff.

Phenomenal duck. Probably the best Peking duck I've had in NYC alongside Decoy. I would recommend ordering the duck and then a few other dishes depending on how many people you are with. There's no real need to order the $85pp set menu - it'll be far too much food. Pretty good wine list.

This is so not a $$ restaurant. I mean I don’t mind paying for a $$$ or $$$$ lunch in Chinatown, but I don’t want to go into a restaurant with an expectation of paying 20 bucks per dish but found out all entree worth more than 40 bucks. The taste is just okay, or even worse than okay. The good sides are the service and the environment in the restaurant.

The nicest staff and the chef was wonderful. He checked on me several times to make sure I was enjoying myself. I fully trusted them for recommendations and I left 100% satisfied. I will be making the trip back with my husband.
(Translated by Google) The latest and cleanest restaurant in Chinatown  (Original) 唐人街最新最干净感觉最靓眼的餐厅

(Translated by Google) Come to eat Michelin's 2-star restaurant. The restaurant looks elegant, clean, delicious food, probably likely to return a lot.  (Original) มาทานอาหารของเชฟมิชิลิน 2 ดาว ร้านดูหรูหรา สะอาด อาหารอร่อย มีโอกาสคงต้องกลับมาก
Yummy
The return of a fantastic institution! So good. Great service.
It was so delicious! We had the Beijing Duck, tang tang noodles and the double sautéed pork belly. It was by far the best food I’ve had here in New York.

First place since we got here and did not disappoint.   Excellent food and service my lady gave the place 5* and she is picky lol.  We had the cold sesame noodles and crispy beef.   It was so good we ordered seconds.    Check it out, you won’t be disappointed .
Loved the duck.  Food and drinks were great.  Staff was excellent! Chef brought us something special that was not on the menu, fantastic and quite spicy.... Loved it!!  Thank you!
Absolutely amazing tasty-worthy restaurant!! It is no cheap, but quality and good service are entirely worth it!! I had a hard time trying not to lick my fingers!

By far and away the best food I have ever had! Great customer service and made me feel like family! Peaking Duck was phenomenal....everything was. You can really taste the love in the food, decor and staff. Highly recommended for an amazing experience and food!!
Great hospitality, food, and ambiance.
Delicious food and excellent services!
Delicious
Good food. The Kung pap chicken is really good. Crispy beef is also good. Go with your friends. Family style
Good food. Nice interior. Pretty inexpensive for a Manhattan dinner.

The staff was the best part of the visit along with their Peking duck. They were very helpful in helping me change my reservation to include more people and also they recommend stuff based on what your preferences are and not on which one is more expensive. A great experience, I recommend it and would be coming back here again.
Peking duck was good!
exceptional service! Every dish is tasty. Always our choice to bring friends
Nice Chinese restaurant. Especially recommend the buns. Definitely try that out!
Methadone!
Upscale restaurant. Great service.  Went there for the Peking Duck.  Did not disappoint. Loved the Grand Marnier shrimp, very fresh. Try the Seafood Pan Fried Angel Hair Noodle.  Will be back.
Lovely place to have Chinese The staff is very helpful and friendly Must visit very delicious food
Maybe not the best menu for single diners. Very old school feel but new school look.

(Translated by Google) Very good food. Mapo tofu is a huge serving. Approximately 100, - for 2 appetizers, 2 main courses, 2 drinks. Staff very attentive.  (Original) Sehr gutes Essen. Mapo Tofu ist eine riesige Portion. Ca. 100,- für 2 Vorspeisen, 2 Hauptgerichte, 2 Getränke. Personal sehr aufmerksam.

This is my favorite Chinese restaurant in NYC. It reminds me of Chinese restaurants in the 1980’s (In a good way) where the staff is slightly fussy and the food is moderately formal. Dumplings and duck are tops in the city!
Great lunch. Great atmosphere and staff. Def recommend.
Very good food. Small portions and small wine pours. The hot & sour soup is great! The pork belly bao was also great!

Upscale Sichuan food, the interior is really lovely example of a refined Chinese dining establishment.  The flavors are fiery and a bit different for my Cantonese background, but I like it. Good place to impress out of town visitors.

Was exceptional!  Had a quick lunch but sampled 4 dishes with a bottle of wine.  Crispy beef and cold sesame noodles were my favorite, but the ginger sliced duck was also excellent.  I might skip the pork dumpling, but it was still well prepared.  Can’t wait to come back on our next trip.   Beautiful restaurant in the midst of bustling China town.  Three spacious floors with nicely set tables and solid service.
Great food! Beautiful place!
(Translated by Google) still alright  (Original) 还可以
Amazing service.
Amazing!!! Crispy beef all day!!

(Translated by Google) Perfect place. Great service. Very Clean, played a nice light music in expensive restaurants. The staff helped in every possible way in choosing a dish, clearly showing photos of food. My wife and I left well-fed and contented. Highly recommended!  (Original) Отличное место. Отличный сервис. Очень Чисто, играла приятная легкая музыка как в дорогих ресторанах. Персонал всячески помогал в выборе блюда, наглядно показывая фото с едой. Ушли с женой сытые и довольные. Очень рекомендуем!

Wow. All I can say is wow. Came here with my partner because we heard they have the best cold sesame noodles, and of all the places we've been, thus far they do! On top of that the other things we tried were SOOO good. We had the sauteed brussel sprouts with chili, and thr grand Marnier prawns. It was soooo delicious. One of the greatest food experiences I've had in a while. The server was so nice too. The place is apparently a NYC cultural intitution and is really high end for Chinatown. 5 stars!!!

Wow wow wow. Sooo good. We have been on the hunt for actual cold sesame noodles done RIGHT not just with some goopy paste and soy sauce. This place was said to have thw best cold sesame noodles in Manhattan and oh my damn. Better than Ollies used to be.  We ordered the veggie dish of spicy Brussels. Fresh and crunchy. Flavorful. Then we ordered the gran marnier prawns with candied walnuts. Id like to swim in the sauce. So frikkkkkkin good!. Totally worth the money. And the entrie place is just classy and nice. Great service.  Shorty Tang's for the WIN!!
Really top notch food and service
we like the resturant , the food , and the service.

What is good for? When you want authentic Szechuan food with a group of friends but would like to make a reservation in advance and have a wider beverage selection than bottles of beer.  The details: Came here because of the Pete Wells review on the NYTimes. We had excellent service at a round table upstairs, all of the waiters were very polite and attentive. They even brought an ice bucket for our bottle of Prosecco. We ordered the Cold Sesame Noodles (10/10), pan fried dumplings (10/10), soup dumplings (7/10), crispy beef (10/10), Kung pao potatoes (very good and had never had before!), hunan chicken, shrimp fried rice and green string beans. The chef even came and spoke with us for a while about the restaurant and kitchen and brought us a round of spicy dan dan noodles. We will definitely be back!
Great service, Peking duck carved tableside, nice ambience, friendly and accommodating staff.
Best Chinese food I've ever eaten.  Restored my faith in Chinese food.  It's a must eat.
For a full duck the amount of meat it yielded was underwhelming, everything else was ok

Table wasn't set up (missing chargers, glasses, and the piece that holds your chopsticks/spoon off the table). Dirty plates and a used napkin under the table. Asked for a new plate, never got one. Ended up snagging one from another table. The fried beef was fantastic. Everything else was eh. Service was lackluster. Two tables were seated after us yet visited before ours. The worst part was when we asked for the rest of our bottle of wine to go. We were informed that 'due to the law,' they couldn't allow us to leave w the bottle but would give us a container instead. They gave us a quart plastic container.
(Translated by Google) Phenomenal  (Original) Fenomenal
Very good food, my group got the Beijing duck along with a handful of other dishes, and we're very satisfied
I really liked the kung pu and hunan chicken. I was also able to watch the new year's parade from the restaurant!
Great food
Very good indeed. Price is reasonable
Wonderful sesame noodles leads you to a wide variety of exotic and tasty dishes. Upscale in presentation and prices
Delicious,

Very slick restaurant.  Great service- the waiters were elegant, if not absent minded (no rice came, wrong dish to wrong table) but very sweet, The Maître d’ played the part of angry, I’m not smiling, ‘hurry-up and order’ to a T.  Food great, crispy duck it was not and don’t try to order anything gluten free. The host will only point you to vegetable dishes.    The rest of the food was amazing: had to take pot luck. And pricey!!!! For that only 3 stars.
It's a very pricy place. Average food quality though.
Great dining experience. The food was amazing and the staff was very hospitable. I especially love Peking duck. Must try!!!

I dedinitely will not going back here. For Michelin stars restaurant, they definitely dont deserve it. It all because of Conny ( i thjnk she’s the manager there), she is very rude and not polite. As a Manager in an high end restaurant she’s definitely dont do her job very professional way. She’s being rude by telling her server to take back the dessert that he’s about to give us on the house. Its not about the free coconut pudding that was sent back but yhe fact that she’s coming over back to our table after our server taking back the dessert and telling us that he should take back the dessert because it was a day old and its not fresh ( and we believe him and fine with that) but then she’s coming over and telling us that he should not do that, giving away free food and taking it back. The only mistake he had is giving us a free complimentary dessert which is an inexpensive dessert ( it doesnt cost them not even $1) but she’s making a very big mistake by coming over and ask him to take away the dessert. It was very very very unfortunate decision on her part which left a bad impression overall for what would’ve been a good dining experience.
Exceptional restaurant in Chinatown.

Had a great lunch, there’s a large variety of dishes, we had the cold noodles, grilledd squid, cucumber salad, hunan chicken, whole fish and mu shoo pork.  Very friendly and attentive service, and very tasty dishes.
Chinatown needs this type of restaurant!!! The food is delicious the service is awesome!!!
Delicious food and excellent service

The experience: Food was good. Service was horrendous. We ordered 9 dishes which is the average number of what everyone else had ordered. Peking duck with 2 vegetables, 1 appetizer, 2 sides, and 3 entree shared dishes. The Peking duck was good. We were the first table to be sat in our area. Every other table around us got their food immediately. Water, drinks, etc. served at a reason time.We sat down. Table isn’t set, water was asked for several times. No one gave us menus to order. Finally, the manager took our order. We waited 1.5 hours for 3 dishes. Food came sporadically and incredible slow. Everyone around us got their food on time. No one checked in on us. We tried several times to flag the waitstaff. No one came. Finally, some more dishes arrived but one of our mains was incorrect. By this time we were confused and upset about the experience thus far. We told the manager, he tried to pass off the incorrect dish as the correct one. We have had the dish before so we know what it looks like. He sends us “complimentary” green beans for the mistake. But it was ice cold compared to other dishes. We figured it was a mistake order they tried to pass off as complimentary. They gave us an excuse that the kitchen is backed up. Which normally I would understand, but that’s not correct if everyone else who came and ordered after us also get their food late... but it was only our table.. Then they said the kitchen lost our order bill... but if that’s the case, why was no one checking on us? they sent another dish complimentary. But that time we were incredibly upset, loss our appetite and horrified by the experience. We didn’t touch the complimentary dishes.. we told them we were disappointed by the experience . Their response? We gave you free stuff. Horrified? So were we. I’ll end the description here.  To the management: We didn’t come there to get free food so thank you for that. We came to eat at the restaurant because we had a positive previous experience eating delicious food. Treating customers with respect shouldn’t have been something we should ask for. This is basic training in hospitality management. Our wait time was ridiculous compared to other tables who came after us, food that was incorrect, the manager to pass off second handed dish as complimentary dishes and overall terrible service. These are horrifying reflections of the restaurant’s management. Do you want your restaurant’s faith to be like that of Dadong? Again, we didn’t ask for the complimentary dishes you brought out. They weren’t what we ordered. We didn’t even eat them. We had ordered what we wanted. We were just looking for good food and family time. Never have I ever experienced such bad service. This will be a meal to remember.

Environment is impeccable and definitely stand out in the whole Chinatown...but I would not call what they have here Szechuan food. It’s more like Guangdong tbh. Lots of traditional Szechuan cuisines were either missing flavor or just not on the menu. Didn’t see a single table of Chinese family on our way up to second flat, guess that explains the authenticity of the food here. Pretty pricey but consider the environment it’s reasonable. Taste? Fine but My grandparents came to NY to visit so we were kind of looking for something more than the spacial experience. And from what we had it was not really satisfying.

If you want to treat your parents or show your friends that Chinese fine dining actually exists, this is a good place. The food is great, the service is attentive, and it has a peaceful atmosphere so you can actually enjoy conversation.
Amazing quality food. First class service. As a lifetime resident of lower Manhattan, Hwa Yuan is one of the only places I will save my cravings for. An absolute must.
I love the place! Came by accident upon the next door hairdresser’s recommendation. Cannot be happier with the quality of the food and the service!
Great decor food is .a little too spicy

This is an upscale Chinese restaurant the food is amazing!! I went to a holiday dinner with a group of friends we were there for hours the dishes kept coming out one dish better than the other omg the service was awesome, Bobby a  professional server, Chef Tang a legendary chef WOW from the apps to the dessert we were so happy, I can't wait to go back, This place is a must, if you love duck don't walk run to Hwa Yuan Szechuan. Thank you!!! Hana A.
Great experience and food. Immediately sat down Sunday at 7 pm
(Translated by Google) There is an ideal boss to open the store.  (Original) 有理想的老板開的店。
(Translated by Google) Deceive the foreigner, expensive and not good  (Original) 骗老外的，贵又不好吃
Excellent food and great service.  I have known the owner and chef, Mr. Tang, for over 30 years. He just keeps getting better.  Cold sesame noodles, Hunan chicken and Beijing duck a must.

The duck, which is what we came for, was delicious. It was a little on the fattier side, but that did not impact the quality of the skin (crispy). All of the accoutrements were fresh. We also ordered the dry crispy beef - it was also very memorable. It wasn’t spicy but still provided a nice crunchy burst of flavor.  We also ordered the tan tan noodles (good, but not memorable) and the soup dumplings. The soup dumplings need to have thinner skins than the ones we had here, but the filling itself was tasty.
Great place to eat, Thank you!
Top notch food complemented with great service and a surprisingly good wine list...
Elegant ambiance for a special occasion and exquisite Chinese dishes. The chicken and rib soup is especially nourishing.
Absolutely the best.
What a great experience here at Hwa Yuan, classic authentic Chinese cuisine with a beautiful atmosphere. Would definitely recommend this place to other true foodies !
Best peking duck I've had in the US. Met the chef, and it's instantly apparent that he genuinely cares about the food and his customers. Definitely go!
Expensive restaurant, beautiful place. Service is great. A fancy place.

I lived in China for four years and this was like going back and enjoying a great meal. Surprising authentic both in food and decor/ambiance. Menu covers many different cuisines from across China and does most of them well. Highlights were the sesame noodles, bok choi in broth, large shrimp fried rice and the duck.

Definitely does NOT cater to the community in which it is located. Having said that, it is a nice option for when you have out of town guests. The interior is very well done.  The staff is attentive.  The food is very salty and insufficiently spicy for it's "Szechuan" name, which leads me to believe they are targeting Western palates instead of Chinese ones.
Totally awesome. Truly delicious upscale Chinese food.
Must try the Peking Duck - best I had in awhile!!  Great friendly service.  Very upscale.
Fantastic food and service.

This was one of the best Chinese meals we've had in New York. We were thoroughly impressed with every single dish we had - from the Peking duck to the noodles and soup dumplings. Their sauteed tangy beef is truly a must try. Also, the service was very attentive and warm, which was a nice change from many other similar restaurants we've been to in NYC/Flushing. Highly recommended!

Upscale Chinese restaurant offering great food and service. It may be a little bit more expensive then your normal place, but the room and decor offer a very relaxing environment. Very attentive staff. The food was authentic and delicious

I was born and bred in Manhattan and grew up eating at the best restaurants in Chinatown.  The reincarnation of Hwa Yuan is my new favorite after five wonderful dinners over the past five months. It’s a little pricey but you definitely get what you pay for: spectacular Szechuan cuisine in a beautifully designed restaurant.  From what I can tell no expense was spared in the restaurant’s construction. It’s beautiful, definitely not your typical Chinatown dive. Their cold sesame noodle are the best I’ve ever had, a subtle sesame flavor with perfectly textured noodles, unlike the typical peanut butter soy concoction noodles at most restaurants. Their Peking duck is second to none, with wonderful flavor and crisp skin, without the fat dripping all over the place. I’ve had their hot & sour soup, eggplant with garlic sauce, fish in hot bean sauce, baked black cod, and spicy wine chicken, among other wonderful dishes.  There is a lot more on the menus and I’m looking forward to exploring new things.
Good environment, and pretty good food. Was sort of expecting the Peking Duck to take me to the moon and back, which it didn’t, but it wasn’t bad.
The food is always delicious here and prepared with great care. Favorites are the spicy scallop,  mapo tofu and the hunan chicken. Oh then there is the delicious snow pea leaves cooked just right.
Fantastic!

(Translated by Google) It is certainly the best Chinese restaurant in NY, I recommend the Peking Duck, the restaurant's best rated dish, Szechuan Tang Tang noodles and also the Seafood fried rice.  (Original) Com toda certeza é o melhor restaurante chinês de NY, recomendo o pato de pequim, prato mais bem avaliado do restaurante, Szechuan Tang Tang noodles e também o Seafood fried rice.

Prices astronomical service inadequate for a busy evening. Staff overwhelmed very disorganized and lost. Food portion sized for supermodels who don’t mind paying $50 for one scallop on a plate. Peking duck not freshly made tastes equivalent to the chef purchasing takeout one block away then reheating it on plate to be served at 8x the price. Limited choices in menu -a lot of spicy dishes. Long wait prior to being seated despite reservations and long wait for each dish to be served. One star for decor and cleanliness.  If you are hungry don’t expect to be full after eating here. Diners come to sit and mingle but not to eat-didn’t realize this was “that” kind of restaurant. Come for ambiance not food. Not family friendly-more for business meetings. Why pay the astronomical prices just to end up hungry? Minimum $100 per person spent and $48 for few cups of tea but left with an empty stomach. Noticed few Chinese patrons in this “Chinese” restaurant located in Chinatown-I wonder why? Don’t believe the 5 star ratings with no comments-they’re made by owners to boost their star ratings. All a true disappointment!
My third visit with significant improvement every time.
Great place for pricey food.

I very much enjoyed my dining experience here at Hwa Yuan Szechuan. Our waitress, Sunny, was very friendly and helpful each time we visited. We also had the privilege of meeting chef Tang who had a personal interest in our dining experience! My colleague and I were blown away with how well they treated us, chef Tang even making a special dish on the house since it was our first time visiting.  Our first visit we had the Kung Po Chicken with hot pepper sauce, the Kung Po baby mix potatoes, the Cold Noodles with Sesame Sauce and the Steamed Spare Ribs Coated with Sticky Rice with a side of rice. Everything was cooked to perfection and tasted wonderful, having the right balance of sweetness with spiciness. We were blown away with how delicious it tasted!  The second time we visited we tried the Bejing Duck (half), the Pan Fried Dumplings and a side of rice. Kevin, the director, was very friendly and helpful and we were delighted with his service! He even surprised us with an additional dish on the house!We thoroughly enjoyed the Bejing Duck as the meat was tender and flavorful and the skin was crispy and delicious!  All in all, there was not a single dish eaten that we did not thoroughly enjoy, not to mention the friendless, hospitality and welcoming nature of every staff member we met! This restaurant, their staff and the chef all deserve the two stars awarded to them by the New York Times critic and more!  If you are ever near China Town, this restaurant is a must. You will not be disappointed!

Everyone here was incredibly cordial and helpful with us, often going out of their way to make sure it was a fantastic experience. You can rely on them to make recommendations for the best food (we asked them to surprise us!). We had such a wonderful time meeting and talking to several different members of the staff and even the chef on one occasion. The quality of some of the food really surprised us, and we'll be sure to come back again when we visit the area.
Dacor and service is good to excellent.  The food is so-so.  Compare to the prices around that area, it is high for Chinese Food standards. Would not go there again.

Had a special Saturday night dinner with three couples, and would rank the experience as one of the greatest I've ever enjoyed in NYC. Staff and service were impeccable, and another thank you to Victor for his expert management. Master Tang himself was extraordinarily generous and friendly, taking time to share his passion , his story, and even some additional and unforgettable dishes. We have not stopped talking about the food, and I plan to make this a regular spot to return to. Do not miss the dry sauteed beef, cold sesame noodles, tang tang noodles, whole fish in bean sauce or, of course, the duck. Thank you all again.
Food is expensive but delicious, good attention to customers, nice recommendations if you don't know what to eat. Fancy decoration, like high class restaurant
Really delicious modern high end Szechuan food. Highly recommend the mapo tofu and tangy spicy beef appetizer!
fine dining , love it
The best Sichuan food, best environment, if you looking for something special and have chef ‘s personal touch - this is the one !
Best in NYC.

This rating is based on the perspective of a person who’s grown up going to Chinatown restaurants that are big enough to host banquets. While it’s a beautifully renovated space, it’s very expensive for a chinese restaurant. I went here one two occasions. Once for dinner and once for an event. Dinner service was ok. We ordered a chicken and a noodle dish, which tasted ok, nothing incredibly impressive especially for a high price. When we came for an event they ran out of food quickly and were slow to refill their buffet, which was disappointing. The prices were as if we were eating in Long Island and not on East Broadway. If I was not familiar with the other offerings in the area I would have enjoyed the food and the price for it more but unfortunately that’s not the case.

Food are good but it has terrible service.  It took 15 mins for any waiter to stop by and take our order after we fully arrived.  It took an hour to receive two apps.  When we got our first entree, Peking duck, they forgot to bring the wrap which took another 5 mins.  After another 30 mins, they brought only one more entree and forgot our last one.  When i asked the waiter about our last entree, it took the them another 10 mins.  Meanwhile, it is close to impossible to get any staff to remove the empty plates.  The best part is when we pay for our tap, the  staff said that we tipped too little (15% of the tab) which i thought we were being nice given the terrible service.  At that point, we told them what they done and stormed out.  For the price that they charge, their total service wasn't good enough for me to even think about going back never the less recommend it to other.  So think twice before you go there or make a reservation.  Good luck!

I don't write a ton of reviews but feel compelled to after my experience at Hwa Yuan. First and foremost, the food was amazing. I ordered the Cold Noodles which apparently are critically acclaimed by the NYP. I have since been back and tried the Peking Duck - which is the best I have had in the city. Lastly, I would like to comment on the staff. I sat at the bar and was taken care of by Edwin, who was behind the bar, and Samantha, whom I believe is a manager. They were extremely friendly and personable, which is something I can't say about the other restaurants in the area. I have Hwa Yuan in my top 5 places in the city and will be using it as my go-to when guests are in town. Thankful that I live close by and can take advantage of their expertise.
One of the best high-end restaurants in Chinatown

Set up a reservation for 11 a week ago for my son's first birthday. When we got here on the day, we were told that the customer that had our table have overstayed for 2 hours and that it should be a 20 minute wait max. Twenty minutes later, we were told that it would be another hour before we could be seated. We ended up sticking it out and waited for over an hour to be seated. We layer found out through another customer that they didn't actually honor the reservations made and just kept seating walk in's to fill their tables. Never again will we waste our time with this restaurant.
Because it was good.
Definitely one of the most authentic Beijing Duck place you can find in NYC. If you don’t like this one, you won’t like the one in Beijing either. 我就北京的 老外的评论都扯淡

I loved everything I tried here. While it's not the first time I tried the Sichuan cuisine, each dish felt like a rediscovery in some way, and, to my uneducated palate, more authentic. The hot pot surprised me by the quantity and diversity of its ingredients.  More expensive that typical for Chinese restaurants in the area, I feel every dollar was worth it and it replaced my previous favorite Sichuan restaurant. I'm looking forward to my next visit. They even have dessert, and it's good; they made it sweet, presumably with the Western palate in mind.  The owner comes around to greet guests. He told us how he reopened the family restaurant my demand of old customers, and he designed everything from the ambience, different in each of the three floors, to the tableware.

This space is beautiful, they must have spent a fortune on it. Unfortunately the food is not up up to spec for Chinatown.  Best dish was probably the cold noodles.  The fish which was supposedly miss priced, making it a deal, it was not fresh and although covered in peppers had no flavor.  Avoid the fish, Major miss. Service is better than average in chinatown, then again we were the only ones there.
Excellent Szechuen resturaunt in the heart of Chinatown.  Elegant,  upscale and delicious.  The duck and whole fish are signature dishes that are best shared.
Good Chinese food in modern settings. Only if the host can smile.
Excellent quality, very tasty, beautiful setting

WORST RESTAURANT IN CHINATOWN. This restaurant gives overpriced food and low portions. The wait for food took over a half an hour. The service was bad too. They charged $10 for store bought tea that was made with tea bags. I would never recommend this restaurant to anyone. Never coming again.
Really nice place with great service on the top, but what you have to know before you go there it's expensive and if you are really hungry eat something before it's not enough, but taste is good.
Delicious food, especially the Kung Pao potato and sesame noodles. Service also exceptional.
First rate Chinese food. The cold sesame noodles are transformative.

I came here twice with my family and I highly recommend you making reservations as it does get crowded during rush hour dinner time.  The food here is delicious, thoughtfully prepared, and tasty...but if you are here during a holiday, the food can be a bit off. Round 1 of the xiao long bao was undercooked and didn't have any soup in them.  They made up a new one for us, but it took a while.  There were odd breaks between our dinner as certain dishes took an inordinate amount of time to come out.  The snow pea leaves in the supreme broth had no broth and quite frankly was over cooked.  The whole dish was bitter and you can barely swallow your food.  This is a whole 180 from the first time we came where everything was spot on...so I am conflicted with my review.  The food then was absolutely amazing and everything came out in a timely fashion.  The peking duck, both times, was delicious and MUCH BETTER than The Peking Duck House on Mott Street.  The service during both times was impeccable.  The wait staff was attentive, polite, and helpful with menu recommendations.  The have an extensive wine selection.  The price is moderate to high for the dishes.  Overall, I suggest you give them a try and assess for yourself.
The chef made us a dish with ox tails that he was considering putting on the menu.  It was devine!
Nice food and clean bathrooms
Excellent food in a beautiful setting with terrific service

Finally! A revival of authentic Chinese (Szechuan style) in heart of Chinatown! The decor, service and design, entrance was solid the moment you walk in, this Is not your typical Chinese restaurant or Seafood place. This place is the standard for any restaurant. We were initially told it’s 45min wait if we wanted to sit in the main area but after speaking to hostess (very courteous) she said we could sit in the tables by the bar and it’s full menu (except Peking Duck), which we’re fine since we actually had it for lunch earlier. We got xialongbao & crispy tangy need as appetizer, mountain ham (Japanese) & snap pea that had Jew’s Ear (type of fungus) and Goji - something Chinese family would make. We also got the Oxtail in chefs specialty and the Whole fish. We enjoyed every dish and my friend just wanted more rice to go with the flavor and sauce.  After we paid the bill, the main chef /owner came over and started explaining how and what type of fish we just had and I had never heard of it. He also told us the ingredients are hand picked and good quality and they don’t cook with ton of oil and it is home style. Which we just rave about it’s like top home cooking, the fact Mr. Tang spent time to engage and tell us how the restaurant “came back” and how he offered to show us around presenting proudly the decor and style he picked and he even did the center piece with fresh flower they get every week so basically got an inside tour!

Food was good, ambiance was nice, and service was mostly attentive, though I had to ask for my water to be refilled several times. I don't think there's anything that really took a star away from the place, just wasn't an all around 5 star experience.
Contemporary interior design, delicious food.

From what I heard, the restaurant was closed for 15 years, and only recently reopened. They completely renovated the inside to look very modern and upscale. All the dishes, utensils, and silverware are custom-made for the restaurant. The …
Decent food, fancy Chinese. Came here for CNY service was terrible. Contrary to what Pete Wells said the duck was much better than the fish!! Sesame noodles is a must get!
Excellent restaurant in Chinatown.
Food for the price isn't worth it. I get the market they're going after but truthfully the same people can go to another place and get the same dishes for cheaper anyplace else in Chinatown

I really enjoyed having dinner at this restaurant. The owners pay very close attention to all the small details. Everything from the service to the food and décor was phenomenal, you can truly feel the full experience of a Chinese eatery. My favorite dishes were the famous cold noodles, tiger shrimp w/ spicy ginger sauce and the peking duck.  I found my new favorite Chinese restaurant in Chinatown!
Good service
The most fresh fish I have ever eaten in NYC. I also like the duck! The environment is also different from most of the Chinese restaurants in New York, which is clean, quiet and decorated.
Amazing food.  Much better than anything I have tried in California.  Very fresh ingredients and dishes.

Best authentic Chinese food I have eaten while traveling throughout the US.  We ordered 12 dishes and everyone was excellent.  The Beijing duck is succulent and very tasty.  I would highly recommend this place for business travelers.  Not a place to eat if your used to eating cheap Chinese fast-food.  Disregard the reviews claiming overpriced.  It's priced quite perfectly for the atmosphere and quality of food.  This is a classy restaurant with very fresh seafood, duck, etc.
(Translated by Google) Delicious  (Original) 好吃上档次
"high" class Chinese food that's overpriced
Nice Deco and great authentic Chinese szchun food
Good cozy Korean in the City.

Just ok Chinese food, at high prices. The crispy beef is actually quite good - not too sweet, and strong black vinegar flavor. "Hot bean sauce" fish was surprisingly bland in taste even though the fish was cooked well, not "hot" at all. Unfortunately the fish was not fully de-scaled (especially around the head), which really put a damper on the whole dish. Kung Pao chicken was recommended and while authentic, lacked the punch and flavor of many better versions that can be found at Sichuan spots throughout the city.

Beautiful space, friendly service but food is extremely overpriced. Portions extremely small and half of the dishes came out lukewarm and almost cold. Crispy tangy beef appetizer was the best thing we ate. Double sautéed pork was mostly vegetables as was the shredded pork. Spicy dishes not particularly spicy. Servers were bringing food that we didn’t order. They seemed confused and it was not crowded. As pretty as the restaurant is the acoustics are awful upstairs. We could barely hear ourselves think because there was a loud drunk table of four across the room that sounded like they were sitting ON our table. Can’t recommend
Best vegetarian Szechuan meal. Attentive and friendly staff, balanced flavors, quick service, beautiful restaurant. I'll definitely be back.
(Translated by Google) Elegant and clean place in Chinatown. Courteous and helpful staff  (Original) Posto elegante e pulito a Chinatown. Personale cortese e disponibile
Awesome fancy Chinese food place with amazing Peking duck. Very large authentic plates of both appetizers and entree's
I don't like that but they have the best crispy duck and everything was good and great forgot to take photos of the food was so good
Way over priced they charge $12 for tea . Portion size very small for the price. I don't know how this place will stay in business.
great space, excellent food, and attentive staff.

We were regulars at the original restaurant and were excited to try the new and improved Hwa Yuan. Boy were we hugely disapponted.  Beautiful new place but unfortunately lacking in every other respect. Service was slow and poor.  We ordered …

Staff was first rate ,  very attentive  to wine pouring, plate changing  and tea service (constantly refilled pot):  the manger Paul attended  to all aspects of the service and the owner and first chef Chen Lee Tang stopped by to inquire about the dinner and to insure that all was first rate. Soup dumplings, sesame noodles and Kung Pao  chicken (dark meat, naturally) were superb. The place is very well put together. A great place for diner with the family and friends.

It was their third day open, so one expects there to be challenges. It's a high end Chinese and quite pricey. The space is massive and most of the appointments like the crockery, chopsticks, and cutlery are quite beautiful. The tea cups only work if you're right handed, but they are nice. There are ornate carved doors, art and decorative pieces throughout the space. The muted grey linens and the waiter uniforms are very tasteful.  There were three different lighting sconces on the same walls in the dining room we were in and completely incongruent overhead fixtures. I'm not sure why the designer chose the lighting scheme. I've seen similar choices in other Chinese places. Perhaps it has to do with feng shui.  The service was terrible. The waitress was very sweet, but her English was hard to understand. She spent a lot of time apologizing.  Most places when you just open, bite the bullet and schedule too much floor and kitchen crew. This was woefully understaffed. People waited and waited to order. Drinks took forever. Tables did not get cleared. Wine got dropped at the table and not opened. People had to beg for their checks. They didn't have things that were on the drink menu, like cranberry juice. There were no limes in the restaurant.  The kitchen was not able to handle the guests. The food took FOREVER with many, many promises that it was coming. We ordered a dish that she said they didn't have. Then she said they had it. By the time our food was supposed to come, they'd run out of it. NOT GOOD.  We waited so long for one of our dishes we said to forget it and asked for the check. Then the dish arrived and we said we didn't want it. They offered it wrap it up for us and take it off the check. We said, "We don't want it." The waitress insisted that we take it, and then never took it off the check.  There was what looked like a manager coming into the dining room periodically, who did NOTHING. Anyone who has ever worked in a dining room could see that tables needed to be bussed and orders needed to be taken, wine poured, etc., but the guy just looked around and walked away.  Now to the food. They serve their famous cold sesame noodles as a very decent sized amuse bouche, if you are lucky enough to get it. I noticed one of the tables near us didn't get it because theirs was served to a different table. When another waiter came out with the noodles that were supposed to be served to the second table he was confused that they already had them. The noodles are very tasty.  The rest of the food was overpriced and some didn't make sense. The first dish was black fungus and frisee. It had a very light black vinegar and sichuan peppercorn dressing that lacked the personality to make the fungus, which is mostly texture and not flavor, interesting.  A dish on the menu was called short Rib on sticky rice. I couldn't find the rice in the dish. It was pleasant tasting pieces of beef atop chunks of sweet potato. I mentioned the lack of rice to the waitress and she said it was amongst the seasoning on the beef. There may have been a few grains, but not enough to say the short rib was on rice.  The hot and sour soup was $10.00 and a single bowl serve. The ingredients were nicer than your average $1.00 bowl of the soup you can grab at many cheap take-out spots in the area, but it was neither hot or sour.  The deluxe seafood lo mein tasted good, but looked terrible for $18.00 and there was something not quite right with the massive sea scallops.  We didn't eat the last one. The shrimp were lukewarm.  The snow peas shoots in broth ($18.00) tasted like snow pea shoots in water. The garlic was tasteless.  The orange beef ($28.00) was what we  took home. They didn't even send white rice with it. It was fine.  They have a long way to go to get the place in order and to become the restaurant that warrants the pricing they are asking for.
